content: rcd digns rachel lynde s apple-leaf quilt by rebecca-ae c do rozario finished measurements 60 inches/152cm square yarn approx 1600g dk/8ply 100% cotton yarn shown in bendigo woollen mills cotton 100% cotton 530 yd/485m per 200g skein mc pastel lime 5 skeins cc1 peppermint 1 skein cc2 pine lime 1 skein cc3 iced matcha 1 skein notions 1 set us 3/3 25mm needles for working flat cable or straight darning needle gauge 20 sts/33 row = 4 inches/10 cm in stockinette stitch this is the story behind my apple-leaf quilt inspired by the work of canadian author l m montgomery her 1908 classic anne of green gables begins not with anne s arrival but with middle-aged mrs rachel lynde sitting at the window knitting another of her famous cotton-warp quilts while keeping a sharp eye on everything that passed the scene for the novel is set through the eyes of a knitter working at her craft locals are in awe of the number of quilts she knits but mrs lynde keeps up with all the news of her neighbourhood as she knits what were these quilts like the quilts - also called bedspreads - were customarily knitted in white cotton economical at the time they were knitted in variously structured counterpanes - squares triangles or stripes sewn together to form the whole where today we re far more focussed on seamless knitting in mrs lynde s time smaller pieces that could be easily picked up put down or carried were more practical particularly when people mostly used pins or straights that couldn t comfortably carry too many stitches rather than cable needles which are more abundant today in knitty winter 2011 franklin habit wrote about mrs lynde her weaponized tongue and expert knitting he gives a wonderful potted history of the quilts but something niggled at me what pattern was she actually using in piecework summer 2023 joyce noverr also wrote a piece on the novels knitted counterpanes including a pattern for a leaf design she had been unable to find the apple- leaf or tobacco-stripe designs that are mentioned by montgomery and settled for a raised- leaf pattern from mrs george cupples 1871 a knitting-book of counterpanes the choice was well-founded as we ll see it s in anne of the island 1915 and anne s house of dreams 1917 that we find the pattern names of apple-leaf and tobacco stripe recorded let s turn to the apple-leaf which is wonderfully apt as montgomery s novels and indeed her life are filled with apples apple orchards apple picking apple blossom and more montgomery even remembers a snatch of poetry written by her school chum alma macneill when they were supposedly doing fractions up in the apple tree under the boughs daisy screeched after them to bring her the cows i always imagine montgomery living in a world of apple trees in anne of the island mrs lynde writes to anne mentioning that she s about to start another quilt
